intro: Clermontia pluriflora, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Clermontia pluriflora is also known for its cultural significance to Native Hawaiians.
